Class.name: EntryPath
Class.summary: Represents a path to a directory or file.

Property.name: Indexer[Int32]
Property.summary: Gets the route at the specified index.
Property.param: The index of the route to retrieve.
Property.returns: The route at the specified index.

Property.name: Indexer[Index]
Property.summary: Gets the route at the specified index using an index object.
Property.param: The index object indicating the route to retrieve.
Property.returns: The route at the specified index.

Property.name: Indexer[Range]
Property.summary: Gets a sub path using the specified range.
Property.param: The range specifying the sub path.
Property.returns: An EntryPath representing the sub path.

Property.name: Length
Property.summary: Gets the number of routes in the EntryPath.
Property.returns: The number of routes in the EntryPath.

Property.name: StringPath
Property.summary: Gets the path as a string.

Method.name: IsSubPathOf[EntryPath]
Method.summary: Determines if the current entry path is a subpath of the specified other path.
Method.param: The other entry path to compare against.
Method.returns: true if the current entry path is a subpath of the other path; otherwise, false.

Method.name: IsParentPathOf[EntryPath]
Method.summary: Determines if the current entry path is a parent path of the specified other path.
Method.param: The other entry path to compare against.
Method.returns: true if the current entry path is a parent path of the other path; otherwise, false.

Method.name: DirectoryName
Method.summary: Gets the directory name part of the current entry path.
Method.returns: An representing the directory name part of the current entry path.

Method.name: EntryName
Method.summary: Gets the entry name part of the current entry path.
Method.returns: An representing the entry name part of the current entry path.

Method.name: CreateFromPath[String]
Method.summary: Creates an instance from the specified path.
Method.param: The path to create an from.
Method.returns: An instance representing the specified path.
